item.title: Best Resources for Tech Interviews
item.description:
Best Books for System Design Interviews

  • System Design Interview – An insider’s guide (Alex Xu)
  • System Design Interview – An Insider’s Guide: Volume 2 (Alex Xu - Sahn Lam)
  • Hacking the System Design Interview: Real Big Tech Interview Questions and In-depth Solutions (Stanley Chiang)
  • Designing Data-Intensive Applications: The Big Ideas Behind Reliable, Scalable, and Maintainable Systems (Martin Kleppmann)
  • Software Engineering at Google: Lessons Learned from Programming Over Time (Titus Winters - Tom Manshreck - Hyrum Wright)
  • System Design Interview: Mastering Basic Introduction to System Analysis and Design (Groks King)
  • Fundamentals of Software Architecture: An Engineering Approach (Mark Richards - Neal Ford)

Best Books for Coding Interviews

  • Algorithms (4th Edition) (Robert Sedgewick - Kevin Wayne)
    • Read the book review here .
  • Introduction to Algorithms, fourth edition (Thomas H. Cormen - Charles E. Leiserson - Ronald L. Rivest - Clifford Stein)
  • Cracking the Coding Interview: 189 Programming Questions and Solutions (Gayle Laakmann McDowell)
  • The Algorithm Design Manual (Texts in Computer Science) (Steven S. Skiena)
  • Programming Interviews Exposed: Coding Your Way Through the Interview (John Mongan - Noah Suojanen Kindler - Eric GiguÃ¨re)
  • Programming Pearls (Jon Bentley)
  • Competitive Programming 3 (Steven Halim)
  • Guide to Competitive Programming: Learning and Improving Algorithms Through Contests (Undergraduate Topics in Computer Science) (Antti Laaksonen)
  • The Art of Computer Programming, Volumes 1-4A Boxed Set (Donald Knuth - John Fuller)
  • The Bible of Algorithms and Data Structures: A Complex Subject Simply Explained (Runtime Complexity, Big O Notation, Programming) (Florian Dedov)
  • A Programmer’s Guide to Computer Science Vol. 2: A virtual degree for the self-taught developer (William M. Springer II - Nicholas R Allgood - Brit Springer)
  • A Programmer’s Guide to Computer Science: A virtual degree for the self-taught developer (William M. Springer II - Nicholas R Allgood - Brit Springer)
  • Computer Science Distilled: Learn the Art of Solving Computational Problems (Wladston Ferreira Filho - Raimondo Pictet)

Best Online Courses for Coding Interviews

  • Algorithms, Part I (Robert Sedgewick, Kevin Wayne)
    • There is a book from the authors (You may find it above)
  • Algorithms, Part II (Robert Sedgewick, Kevin Wayne)
    • There is a book from the authors (You may find it above)
  • Divide and Conquer, Sorting and Searching, and Randomized Algorithms (Tim Roughgarden)
  • Graph Search, Shortest Paths, and Data Structures (Tim Roughgarden)
  • Greedy Algorithms, Minimum Spanning Trees, and Dynamic Programming (Tim Roughgarden)
  • Shortest Paths Revisited, NP-Complete Problems and What To Do About Them (Tim Roughgarden)
  • Algorithms Specialization (Tim Roughgarden)
  • Data Structures and Algorithms Specialization (Neil Rhodes, Daniel M. Kane, Michael Levin, Pavel Pevzner, Alexander S. Kulikov)

If you need further guidance or mentorship, drop me a line
